ijp.controller

Class WorldController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ijp.controller.WorldController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Controller, javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class WorldController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, Controller
    A controller for the HomeViewr application, which uses events to rotate and move to different locations.
    Version:
    1.0.4, 27 Nov 2015
    Author:
    Konstantinos Zacharis (s1569729@sms.ed.ac.uk)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkItemsPosition()
      Show or hide items depending on their position.
      void clickItems()
      Can drop or pick up an item by clicking on the according ImageView.
      void consoleOutput()
      consoleOutput is using the redirectText to write the console output with OutputStream.

      Drop basket only if it is stored in Inventory and place it in specific location that is set.

      Pick up the item Tree.
      void randomLocation(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      randomLocation is used to transfer the user to a random side and room of the home.

      redirectText shows the console output in text area.

      • dropHelmet

        public void dropHelmet()
        Drop the item helmet only if it is stored in Inventory and place it in specific location that is set. A message is printed according to all cases.

      • pickUpHelmet

        public void pickUpHelmet()
        Pick up helmet from a selected side of a room and place it in the inventory. A message is printed according to all cases.

      • dropGuitar

        public void dropGuitar()
        Drop guitar only if it is stored in Inventory and place it in specific location that is set. A message is printed according to all cases.

      • rotateLeft

        public void rotateLeft(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        rotateLeft is used to show the left image of the image shown when pressing the left button. It also keeps track, whether the items should be shown or not.
        Specified by:
        rotateLeft in interface Controller
        Parameters:
        event - The event is used to represent the action.

      • rotateRight

        public void rotateRight(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        rotateRight is used to bring the right image when pressing the right button. It also keeps track, whether the items should be shown or not.
        Specified by:
        rotateRight in interface Controller
        Parameters:
        event - The event is used to represent the action.
